title: Standard Plank
description: The foundational isometric hold for core stability.

tips.text: Squeeze glutes and tuck pelvis (posterior pelvic tilt).

title: Regular Push-up
description: Standard horizontal pressing movement.

tips.text: Chest to floor, full lockout at top.
Allows for neutral wrist position and deeper ROM.
Turn rings out at the top.

title: Hollow Body Hold
description: Foundational gymnastic shape. Lower back must stay glued to the floor.

tips.text: If lower back lifts, raise legs higher.

title: Pike Hold
description: Static hold to build overhead endurance in the shoulders.

tips.text: Push the floor away, elevate scapula.
Keep elbows locked.

title: Australian Pull-up
description: Horizontal pulling movement with feet on the ground.

tips.text: Keep body in a straight plank line.
Pull rings to armpits.

title: Frog Stand
description: Bent-arm balance hold, knees resting on elbows.

tips.text: Look forward to form a triangle with hands and head.
Grip the bars tightly to balance.

title: Floor Pike Push-up
description: Vertical pressing movement with feet on the floor.

tips.text: Head goes forward, not just down.
Go deeper for more ROM.

title: Regular Pull-up
description: Vertical pulling movement from a hang.

tips.text: Chin over bar, full lockout at bottom.
Start with palms forward, rotate to palms facing you.

title: Skin the Cat
description: Rotational movement for shoulder mobility and strength.

tips.text: Keep arms straight throughout the rotation.
Use a pronated grip.

title: Wall Walk
description: Walking feet up the wall into a handstand position.

tips.text: Walk hands in as close to wall as possible.

title: Elevated Pike Push-up
description: Pike push-up with feet raised on a box.

tips.text: Keep hips stacked over shoulders.
Utilize full range of motion.

title: Chest-to-Wall Handstand
description: Static handstand hold facing the wall.

tips.text: Only toes and nose should touch the wall.

title: Tuck Front Lever Hold
description: Static hold with knees tucked to chest.

tips.text: Retract scapula strongly.
Keep rings close to body.

title: Scapular Pull-in (Front Lever)
description: Straight arm pull initiating from the scapula.

tips.text: Keep arms dead straight.

title: Kick-up to Handstand
description: Dynamic entry into freestanding handstand.

tips.text: Keep arms locked before you kick.

title: Tuck Front Lever Row
description: Rowing in the tucked front lever position.

tips.text: Pull waist to the bar.
False grip helps.

title: Back-to-Wall Handstand Push-up
description: HSPU facing away from wall. Easier to balance than chest-to-wall but less strict.

tips.text: Don't over-arch lower back.

title: Freestanding Handstand
description: Static balance in open space.

tips.text: Grip floor with fingers.
Use wrist flexion to balance.

title: Advanced Tuck Front Lever Hold
description: Front lever with back flat, legs tucked but knees past vertical.

tips.text: Back must be parallel to ground.

title: Advanced Tuck FL Row
description: Rowing with a flat back and open tuck.

tips.text: Touch stomach to bar every rep.

title: HSPU Negative (Eccentric)
description: Lowering slowly from freestanding handstand to headstand.

tips.text: 5 second count on the way down.

title: Full Front Lever Hold
description: Completely straight body horizontal hold.

tips.text: Squeeze glutes and point toes.
Much harder stabilization required.

title: Freestanding Handstand Push-up
description: Full press from head to lockout without wall support.

tips.text: Keep body tight, don't arch.
The deficit makes it significantly harder.
Turn rings out; keep rings under shoulders throughout.

title: Front Lever Pull-up
description: Pulling from full front lever to horizontal bar touch.

tips.text: Maintain horizontal bodyline throughout.
False grip is essential here.

title: Pseudo Planche Lean
description: Top of a push-up position with shoulders leaned forward past the wrists. The entry point for straight-arm strength.

tips.text: Turn hands out 45 degrees to reduce wrist strain.
Allows for a deeper lean with less wrist pressure.

title: Pseudo Planche Push-up
description: Push-up maintaining a forward lean throughout the movement. Hands should be at waist level at the bottom.

tips.text: Lean forward as you push up; do not rock back.
Keep elbows tucked close to the body.
Turn rings out at the top of every rep.

title: Tuck Planche Hold
description: Static hold supporting bodyweight on straight arms with knees tucked to chest.

tips.text: Easier on wrists than floor. Lock elbows completely.
Requires significant wrist mobility.
Rings must stay close to the body. Turn rings out.

title: Tuck Planche Push-up
description: Pressing from the floor while maintaining the tuck planche shape. Feet do not touch the ground.

tips.text: Control the descent; do not crash down.
Lean forward to counterbalance hips.
Squeeze rings inward to stabilize; keep elbows tucked.

title: Advanced Tuck Planche Hold
description: Tuck planche with a flat back (hips at 90 degrees). Scapula protracted and depressed.

tips.text: Think about flattening your lower back.
Lean further forward than regular tuck.

title: Advanced Tuck Planche Push-up
description: Push-up maintaining the flat-back advanced tuck position.

tips.text: Full ROM: shoulders down to hand level.
Keep scapula protracted at the top.

title: Straddle Planche Hold
description: Planche with legs wide apart. Reduces lever arm compared to full, but requires hip mobility.

tips.text: Wider straddle makes the hold easier.
Turn rings out fully (RTO) for proper form.

title: Straddle Planche Push-up
description: Pressing bodyweight with legs in straddle position. No feet touching the ground.

tips.text: Maintain the straddle height throughout the rep.
Significant chest recruitment required to stabilize rings.

title: Full Planche Hold
description: Legs together, straight body parallel to the ground. The gold standard of straight-arm statics.

tips.text: Point toes hard to engage entire posterior chain.
Fingers sideways or backwards.
Turn rings out fully (RTO) and keep them under shoulders.

title: Full Planche Push-up
description: Push-up with body completely straight and parallel to the floor.

tips.text: Don't let hips sag at the bottom.
Lean is extreme at the bottom position.
Turn rings out at the top; keep rings beneath shoulders throughout.

title: Archer Pull-up
description: Pulling up while straightening one arm to the side. The first step towards single-arm strength.

tips.text: Try to put as little weight as possible on the straight arm.
Turn the pulling ring in towards chest.

title: Typewriter Pull-up
description: Holding top position and sliding body from left to right hand.

tips.text: Keep chin above bar level the entire time.

title: Assisted One Arm Pull-up
description: Pulling with one arm while using a band or fingers for minimal assistance.

tips.text: Use 2 fingers on the non-working hand to assist.

title: One Arm Pull-up Negative
description: Jump to top with one arm locked off, lower as slowly as possible.

tips.text: Fight gravity. Don't drop into the shoulder socket at bottom.

title: One Arm Pull-up
description: The ultimate vertical pulling feat. Pulling chin over bar with a single arm.

tips.text: Control rotation. Drive the elbow down to the hip.
Harder due to rotation instability.

title: Explosive Pull-up
description: Pulling with maximum speed to get the chest or belly button to the bar.

tips.text: Aim to hit the bar with your lower chest.

title: Chest Dip
description: Fundamental vertical pushing movement.

tips.text: Lower until shoulders are below elbows.
Requires balancing the torso over the bar. Touch chest to bar.
Turn rings out at the top. Keep elbows tucked.

title: Muscle-up Transition (Negative)
description: Start at support and slowly lower yourself through the deep dip transition to the hang.

tips.text: Control the 'drop' moment where elbows go below bar.
Keep rings touching your chest. Essential for learning the path.

title: Bar Muscle-up
description: Getting from a hang to a support position on the bar.

tips.text: Kipping: drive knees up explosively.
Strict: wrists must rotate over the bar early.

title: Strict Muscle-up
description: Dead hang to support on rings. Requires false grip and strict pulling mechanics.

tips.text: Rotate wrists over the bar early during the transition.
Pull to lower chest, then lean forward to get on top.
Maintain False Grip throughout the pull.
Trace the outline of your chest with the rings.

title: Side Plank
description: Foundational lateral stability hold.

tips.text: Keep hips stacked vertically.

title: Human Flag Support
description: Vertical hold gripping the bars to build shoulder conditioning for the flag.

tips.text: Bottom arm pushes hard, top arm pulls hard.
Keep body vertical.

title: Tuck Human Flag
description: Holding the horizontal flag position with legs tucked to chest.

tips.text: hips must be level with shoulders.

title: Straddle Human Flag
description: Human flag with legs wide apart to reduce leverage.

tips.text: Top leg forward, bottom leg back prevents rotation.

title: Full Human Flag
description: Body completely horizontal and straight held sideways.

tips.text: Lock out the bottom arm completely.

title: Human Flag Pull-up
description: Pulling the body up while maintaining a horizontal flag position.

tips.text: Entirely lats and oblique strength.

title: Air Squat
description: Basic bodyweight squat.

tips.text: Keep heels on the ground.

title: Bulgarian Split Squat
description: Single leg squat with the rear foot elevated.

tips.text: Keep torso upright to target quads, lean forward for glutes.

title: Shrimp Squat
description: Single leg squat holding the non-working foot behind you.

tips.text: Try to touch your back knee to the floor.

title: Assisted Pistol Squat
description: Single leg squat with the front leg straight, using support for balance.

tips.text: Use the pole only for balance, not to pull yourself up.
Squat down to a box and stand back up.

title: Pistol Squat
description: Full single leg squat with the other leg extended forward.

tips.text: Keep the heel of the standing foot planted.
Mobility is usually the limiting factor.

title: Dragon Squat
description: Advanced single leg squat where the non-working leg threads behind the standing leg.

tips.text: Requires rotational knee stability and glute power.

title: German Hang
description: Hanging from the bar/rings with arms rotated backwards. The foundational stretch for Back Lever and Hefesto.

tips.text: Let your shoulders relax and stretch. Don't pull yet.
Easier on the shoulders as rings can rotate.

title: Tuck Back Lever
description: Holding a horizontal position facing the floor with legs tucked to chest.

tips.text: Squeeze glutes slightly to flatten lower back.
Keep palms facing down (pronated) or back (supinated - harder).

title: Advanced Tuck Back Lever
description: Back lever with flat back, hips at 90 degrees.

tips.text: Create a flat shelf with your back.

title: Full Back Lever
description: Complete straight body horizontal hold facing the floor.

tips.text: Supinated grip (palms up) conditions biceps for Hefesto.
Rings allow natural rotation.

title: Hefesto Curl (Negative)
description: Starting from back support, curling down slowly into a back lever.

tips.text: Do not let elbows flare out.

title: Hefesto
description: Curling the body from a Back Lever position up behind the back into a support hold. The ultimate bicep feat.

tips.text: Keep wrists fully supinated; keep elbows in front of torso throughout.
Rings can move away from you, making leverage harder.

title: Iron Cross Support
description: Holding a T-pose on rings. Arms completely straight.

tips.text: Start with a false grip.
Push down on the rings, don't just hang.

title: Maltese Lean
description: Leaning forward from a planche position, lowering shoulders closer to hip level.

tips.text: Hands wider than planche lean.
Lower from support towards Maltese, hold, and pull back.

title: Straddle Maltese
description: Body horizontal, arms wide at 45 degrees or lower, legs straddled.

tips.text: Fingers backwards or sideways.
Arms should be almost parallel to the body.

title: Full Maltese
description: Body straight and horizontal, arms wide. Lower and harder than a Planche.

tips.text: Hands very wide with fingers backward; lock elbows and depress scapulae.
Keep rings turned out; maintain slight external rotation at the shoulders.

title: Victorian Cross
description: An inverted Iron Cross / Maltese. Body is horizontal, facing up, arms pushing down by hips.

tips.text: Use a rigid supinated grip; keep bar near hips; elbows locked.
Use false grip; control ring rotation; maintain depressed scapulae.

title: Hanging Leg Raise
description: Core compression exercise hanging from the bar.

tips.text: Don't use momentum/swinging. Control the descent.

title: L-Sit
description: Static hold supporting body with legs extended forward at 90 degrees.

tips.text: Push shoulders down hard. Lock knees.
Requires more flexibility and compression strength.
Turn rings out slightly for stability.

title: Reverse Plank
description: Posterior chain static hold facing upwards.

tips.text: Push hips up, squeeze glutes and shoulder blades.

title: Arch Body Hold (Superman)
description: Lying on stomach, lifting arms and legs to engage posterior chain.

tips.text: Lift thighs and chest off the ground simultaneously.

title: Glute Bridge
description: Lying on back, lifting hips to ceiling.

tips.text: Squeeze glutes at the top. Don't hyperextend back.
